data.description:
The time is told by a 6 pointed star shape in an analogue format.  Each of the points is faceted into two halves to create 12 facets in total and divided into an inner ring for hours and an outer ring for 5 minute blocks. The ends of four of the points display single minutes to be added to the 5-minutes.


The first three images are screenshots showing:  
(1) 08:20 
(2) 09:03 
(3) 00:34

The last two images are not screenshots, but explain how to read the time.


The design for this watchface originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio and was created by Peter Fletcher.   It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/01/16/dark-star-led-watch-lights-up-facets-to-tell-time/

To see other sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces, click on "More from this Developer".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for color (Pebble Time/Pebble Time Steel/Pebble Time Round), Pebble 2 and Quick Views.

data.author: Christian Liljeberg

changelog.release_notes:
- Fixes problem with inverting screen colors on Pebble Time 2.
- Fixes a problem when displaying really cold temperatures.

- Fixes an issue with weather updates using Yahoo and GPS.
- Fixes error when using miles for distance walked.
Bug fixes and minor improvements.

- Added an option disable Health data in the popup window.
- You can now set your own colors for the popup window. The color settings can be found in the weather settings.
- The wind speed unit now defaults to whatever Yahoo or Forecast.io sends. 
- Other minor cosmetic fixes.

- Added popup window with health data and more weather data. Shake your watch twice!
- Support for custom location when using Forecast.io.
- No more woeid's when using Yahoo! Just enter your location in plain text!
- Fixed weather icon sometimes not switching to day version.
- Added Russian and Czech languages.
- Fixed problem with weather not being completely hideable on Round.

+ Adds option to use Forecast.io instead of Yahoo as weather data provider.
+ Rewritten to allow for future feature additions.

Fixes problem with temperature only displaying as Fahrenheit.
Adds Turkish language option.
Improvements and changes to ensure an uninterrupted geolocation service.
Fixes an issue with geolocation which caused the weather updates to fail if using GPS.
+ Workaround to make geolocation work again.
- Fixes a bug that caused custom color weather icons to always be white.
- Workaround to get current forecast data.
+ Adds support for Pebble Time Round!
Should fix a very strange weather display problem for some users. Also, you can now switch between C and F without a long delay.
+ Another weather related fix.
+ Fixes a bug introduced in 2.33 which caused the weather and sometimes the date to disappear in Autobahn layout. Sorry for the trouble.
Quick fix to add weather filtering and caching.
Fixes broken Bluetooth symbol from 2.31 and adds weather debug information to the settings page.
Quick fix to notify the user if the weather data from Yahoo is old. No weather will be displayed if the reported data is more than about 24 hours old.

+ Added quiet time option
+ Various bug fixes (no more double vibrations)
+ Two new languages: Finnish and Portuguese

data.description:
Now with Pebble Health! Shake your watch twice to see it!

A clean, glanceable, watchface based on the DIN Engschrift typeface with fully customizable colors. Time is right or left aligned so it is the first you see when you pull up your sleeve. 

Battery status, bluetooth warning, weather, seconds and date can be individually disabled for an extra simplified look.

Features:
- Time in big, easy to read, DIN Engschrift, in full custom colors!
- Layout options for left or right hand use, so you can glance in any way you like!
- Shareable color sets!
- Date and day of week in many languages.
- Weather, provided by Yahoo or Forecast.io, with custom icons and temperature in C or F.
- Battery level.
- Bluetooth disconnect warning (with optional vibration).
- Optional vibration every 60, 30 or 15 minutes.
- Optional seconds!
- Quiet mode (no vibrations) between set hours.
- Now with extra information, shake you watch twice for wind speed, direction, feel like temperature, humidity, barometric pressure, sunrise and sunset. Also Pebble Health: steps, distance, calories burned, active time and sleep time!

Geolocation data © OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0. http://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright

latest_release.release_notes:
- Fixes problem with inverting screen colors on Pebble Time 2.
- Fixes a problem when displaying really cold temperatures.

data.title: DIN Time

data.description:
Need to know the time? We got that. Need to know if your favorite airport is VFR, MVFR, IFR, or LIFR? We got that too...and that's it!

At-a-glance aviation weather on your wrist made by a pilot for pilots. This is a minimal version of METAR Watchface. Using the same parser, this watchface shows only the time, station, and flight rules.

Background will be black if the last fetch was not successful while continuing to show the most recent data.

Bug fix where data would not update

data.description:
Pebble watchface with digits made out of tetriminos.

When time changes, old digit vanishes and new digit is reassembled out of falling tetriminos.

Optionally shows date and weekday. Supports battery and bluetooth connection status. Can be configured to vibrate on bluetooth disconnection/reconnection.

Press 'Settings' button in Pebble app to configure the watchface to your liking.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed crash on startup on pebble and pebble time.

data.description:
Mars Red orbital circles displaying time (including seconds), date, current temperature and wind speed, graphical and numeric battery level (with charging indicator) and Bluetooth disconnection alert.

On Bluetooth connection lost, icon will flash for 20 seconds before vibrating to confirm connection lost. Useful reminder if you leave your phone behind when leaving the house! If weather cannot be loaded within 60 seconds (due to no bluetooth or internet connection) the day of the week will be displayed until connection is re-established.

data.description:
Fully configurable watch face to show time in two different timezones. Select your secondary clock location from settings. Supports all cities/timezones on Earth.

Once set, watchface persists your settings on watch so you don't have to reset if you switch watchfaces.

It does not use location data and all that jazz, you specify what timezone/city you want, it delivers.

To recap, created a watchface, didn't solve climate change or P = NP.


Note
- If you fly to a different timezone or any of the two timezones change due to daylight saving, you'll have to set-up the watchface again to show correct time for your secondary location.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed broken settings issue

data.description: Gives the time as well as the current height of the Bitcoin Block Chain.  Useful if you are using nLockTime in your Bitcoin transaction builds and need to know the current height ("time") of the Block Chain.  Basically came out of a group discussion at Blockchain University (http://www.blockchainu.co/) as we needed a way to determine relative time during the creation of various DApp's.

data.description:
A digital watch with the digits in the four quadrants, cut down the middle and positioned against the sides of the display, so you can still determine what the digit would be.  They are somewhat curved digits, to give a more abstract feel to the display.  

The top left and top right are the hours, and bottom left and bottom right are the minutes.

The original design had LEDs in the relevant positions that were used in different combinations to give the numbers – this resulted in different sizes for the different numbers.  These same forms have been kept here, so some numbers are larger than others – this adds to the very different look.

Display can now be in 12 or 24-hour mode depending on watch settings and both number and background colors are configurable.


Screenshots:  
 (1) 09:38
 (2) 05:56
 (3) 16:47
 (4) 21:52
 (5) 23:44


The design for this watchface was created by Heather Sable Villano and Matthew Weiss and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   It is published with the designers’ permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/12/31/kizamu-led-watch-takes-the-edge-off/

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time / Time Steel, Pebble 2 and Quick Views.   12 or 24 hour mode depending on watch settings.  Configuration options (inverting colors for B&W watches and choice of number / background colors for color watches).

data.description:
An analog watchface with 5-minutes located around the outer edge with blocky shapes and hours located a little further in as round shapes against the circuits.

Single minutes are located at top and bottom, displayed as Volts & Amps (continuing the electrical/circuitboard theme).
At the top, 1 minute appears as “1V” and 2 minutes as “1-1V” (adding these together gives 2 minutes). 
At the bottom, 3 minutes appear as“3A” and 4 minutes as “1-3A” (adding 1 & 3 gives 4).

To tell the time, locate the shapes (hours and 5-minutes) around the edges and add the single minutes. 

On the left is a battery indicator, in 20% increments.

On the right are AM/PM indicators – AM top, PM bottom.

The circuits leading to the time indicators don't indicate anything, but the changing effect as hours and 5-minutes pass provide an almost random appearance.

There is a configuration screen allowing color changes for the 5-minutes/shapes, hours/AM-PM/single minutes and battery level.


Screenshots:
 (1) 14:36 (battery 100%)
 (2) 09:04 (battery 100%)
 (3) 15:57 (battery 40%)
 (4) 00:08 (battery 40%)
 (5) 01:15 (battery 100%)


This design was created by Justin Schofield and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   The watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2015/01/19/circuit-watch-creates-electronic-pathways-to-display-time/
(this had hours & 5-minutes in reverse - we changed to a more normal configuration here)

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel and Pebble 2.  Configuration option to invert colors for B&W watches and the set colors for color ones.

data.title: Circuitboard

data.author: Nick Hayward
data.description:
With the release of Pebble Time, we are introducing a watch face that is breaking the barriers of time on earth and expanding to the solar system. This watch face beautifully encompasses the rotation of the earth around the sun by day, and the moon orbiting the earth by night. The Pebble Time’s 65 colors are on display in the solar system and the stars far beyond, included is the temperature and weather condition of any current location.

Marketing
Sam Hayward

Design
Chandler Erisman

data.description:
≡njoy the beauty of abstracted time. 
Free of conventions, full of lines.
Specially designed for both 12h or 24h preferences, BLOCKclock reveals a visual snapshot of a moment in the continuum of the day. Hours past are complete, current time is in progress, the future doesn't exist yet.

Eventually you'll recognize meaningful events in your routine such as lunch, end of working day, last call, late night programming sessions.

latest_release.release_notes: v1.1 - fixed 12h bug

data.title: BLOCKclock

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel, Pebble Time Round, Pebble 2 and Quick Views.

data.description:
Design from Peter Fletcher (who has designed watches for Tokyoflash), produced exclusively for the Pebble.  

The time is told by the lights in the gaps on the wheel shape disappearing.

There are 12 rows of lights highlighting the 12 hour positions of an analogue clock.

Each light represents a 15-minute increment. 

There are a further 14 lights around the outside that represent single minutes (starting with the top right one for 1 minute).

3 final points to note: 
- At 12:00 all hour & 5-minute lights are off
- At 00:00 all hour & 5-minute lights are on
- On a Quick View, the top 4 single minutes split


Screenshots:  01:59, 09:36, 12:00, 00:00, 02:04 (with Quick View)


This watchface has been co-developed with the designer and is published with the designer's permission.  

To see watchfaces designed by Peter for Tokyoflash, along with others from the Tokyoflash Design Studio sanctioned by Tokyoflash, click on "More from this Developer".

Added color and round support. Added configuration option. Requires Pebble firmware v3.9 or later.

data.description:
Analog style watch.  
The rings that radiate from the middle of the display are for the hours.  These change from the background to foreground color as the hours increase.  
As the hours light up, they include smaller rings positioned appropriately as per an analog display (this creates the Phi-like spiral). These are filled to show the 5-minute positions and these continue beyond the hour rings if the 5-minutes exceed the hours.  The 5-minutes are displayed in the inverse colour to that of the hour rings.
Single minutes are show by four smaller rings that appear in the twelve o'clock position, again with inverse fill as the minutes increase. 

There is a choice of foreground color on the configuration page.
  

Screenshots:  9:31, 12:59, 7:45, 8:04
 

This design was created by Peter Fletcher and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   it is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/06/27/phi-ocular-could-be-watching-you/

data.description:
Oweather is an app designed for the Pebble watch, which retrieves weather data from your current location. 

It displays a small icon on the watch face that indicates the weather. 

It uses the phone GPS, but you can enter the locality for which you want the current weather. 

When using the GPS, it retrieves the location from Gisgraphy's web service. 

The icons come a friend of mine Laea Sandra Bread : https://www.facebook.com/pages/Les-calligraphies-de-Laea/270037116348916?fref=ts

*timeline support is in progress*

For bug reports or features requests, please send an email to oupsman@oupsman.fr

hh:mm (12h)

By design, automatically displays in all languages that are officially supported by Pebble watch. (Currently: English, French (Français), German (Deutsch), Spanish (Español))  If, in the future, a new official language is added to Pebble watch, it will display correctly in the new language (given the new language is set by the user in the Pebble app (Android or iOS)).

data.author: Turner Yey

changelog.release_notes: Made hourly vibrate 10 seconds late
Added hourly vibrate
added support for auto detecting GPS location
Switched from the Forecast API to the Daily API for accuracy.

data.description:
The watch hands are aesthetically round and pleasing to the eye and readable from afar. Enjoy this contemporary classical analog time piece with your friends and co-workers. Inspired by the Japanese art of zen gardens, which are round and peaceful.

Watch face has the following complications:

- Day of week and day of month
- Battery level (only shows when under 30% or charging)
- Bluetooth indicator shows BT when disconnected and also vibrates
- Weather icon (sun, cloudy, rain, thunder, haze)
- High/low daily temperature (Celsius or Fahrenheit)
- Sunrise/sunset time

Watch also has these additional features:

- Specify the time frame when weather data should be fetched/updated (default is to update after midnight)
- Specify how often to update (every X hours)
- Shows tomorrow's weather after 9pm (configurable)
- Optional white background
- Hourly vibrate (with unique pattern for each hour)

You can specified your city by manually typing in latitude and longitude coordinates or using the GPS of your phone.

The hourly vibrate uses roman numerals to indicate the hour:

3 o'clock = III = short+short+short
6 o'clock = VI = long+short
9 o'clock = IX = IVV = short+long+long
12 o'clock = XII = VVII = long+long+short+short

The hourly vibrate is late by 10 seconds to avoid overlapping with vibrations from calendar events.

latest_release.release_notes: Made hourly vibrate 10 seconds late

data.description:
At-a-glance aviation weather on your wrist made by a pilot for pilots. This open-source watchface organizes and displays the METAR report for your favorite or nearest airport. Unlike some watchfaces which only display the raw text, we make sense of the data. This allows us to better arrange your report and even determine the current Flight Rules.

Know immediately when your favorite airport is under VFR, MVFR, IFR, or LIFR.

Header: Local time (12 or 24), ICAO station ID, Flight rules
Row1:  Current Zulu time, Issue time, Minutes since issued
Row2:  Wind direction, Wind speed including gusts (KT/MPS)
Row3:  Temperature (C), Dewpoint (C), Altimeter (InHg/hPa)
Row4:  Visibility (SM/km), Other WX Codes (ex: -SN, NOSIG)
Row5:  Bottom two cloud layers (ex: OVC020)

Background behind "minutes since issue" will be red if the last fetch was not successful.

Updated 2016-10-31:
New AVWX endpoint, new menu icons

Note: METARs come in two variants: International and North American. Both variants use different units for visibility and altimeter. While the altimeter value is easy to tell apart, visibility is not. Though the unit is not displayed on screen, an altimeter around 1000 will always have vis reported by km, and an altimeter around 29.92 will always have vis reported by SM. Some stations report wind speed in MPS rather than KT, but these units will always be displayed on screen.

latest_release.release_notes:
New AVWX endpoint
New menu icons

This watchface is to display a "true" binary time of the day, not bcd encoded hours/minutes/seconds.

for reference, this is a good explanation:
http://www.abulsme.com/binarytime/

I added Month and Date support, just shake on the Z axis.
the top line is the month (LSB on the right). Don't get confused by the "decoration" in the second line.
Day is on the bottom again LSB is to the right.

UPDATE 2-26-15: New version out with hourly vibration and configuration.

Time is told by the the hard line between black and white. The inner disk is the hour "hand" and the outer ring is the minute "hand". For example, the first screenshot reads 12:00 and the second screenshot reads 10:10.

This watchface is an attempt to emulate the i-Toc watch. You can see more about the i-Toc at http://www.i-toc.com/

I have no affiliation with i-Toc and am not trying to make any money from the distribution of this watchface. Please contact me if you make i-Toc and want me to remove this from the store.

data.description:
Digital watchface where the time is told by four round displays each showing a digit wrapped around the center of the display. 
The right-hand side of the digit at the top, slightly left of center and the left-hand side at the other end of the ring slightly right of center. 
This is similar to the numbers displayed in “Digital Warp”, but separated out.  
The top two displays are the hours and the bottom two the minutes.

Screenshots show:  
(1) 09:24 
(2) 23:08 
(3) 19:44
(4) 07:56
(5) 12:07 (with Quick View)

This design was created by Peter Fletcher and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  The watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/07/01/quad-warp-a-twisted-digital-watch/

data.description:
Tell the time like a Viking!!!!!! (if they had watches)

Shows the time in Old Norse using the younger Futhark runes. Also vibrates when your watch disconnects from phone. Time is in 12 hour format. The time in the screenshot says nine three and twenty, which is 9:23.

This is how I transcribe the Old Norse for the numbers into runes.

in one 
tfiR two 
þriR three
fioriR four
fim five
siks six
siau seven
ata eight
niu nine
tiu ten
ililfu eleven
tolf twelve
þritan thirteen
fiortan fourteen
fimtan fifteen
sikstan sixteen
siautan seventeen
atian eighteen
nitian nineteen
tutuku twenty
þriR tiki thirty
fioriR tiki forty 
fim tiki fifty

The font is from here

http://www.fonts2u.com/danish-futhark-sharp-regular.font

I can't figure out the licence, so I may not be able to use it.

data.description:
The time is told on four circular dials, cut into segments - the number of segments in the circle equals the number.
Empty circle with no segments = 0, a dot in the middle creates one segment = 1, a line dissecting the circle in two = 2 and so on.

The two top dials are for hours and the bottom two for minutes. 

Time is displayed in 12 or 24-hour mode, depending on the watch settings.

Configuration option to change the foreground color.

The three screenshots are examples and show:  
(1) 23:59 
(2) 07:38 
(3) 16:24

This watchface originally appeared as a design on the Tokyoflash Design Studio and was created by Peter Fletcher.  It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/05/25/division-lcd-watch-tells-time-in-segments/

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2, color on Pebble Time watches, Pebble Time 2 and Quick Views.  Added configuration options: inverting colors on black & white Pebbles and choice of foreground color for color Pebbles.

data.title: Division

Introducing the pinnacle of practical Pebble parenting functionality!

Fed up arguing how late is 'late' with your little ones at bed time? Solve all disagreement with this handy watchface that simply says 'Bed time'. 'Nuff said.

data.description: Displays the beautiful faces of all 9 members of the Korean girl group SNSD (Girls' Generation) with the current time. Screen updates once a minute, starting from a random member, and rotating in the order of (from oldest to youngest): Taeyeon, Jessica, Sunny, Tiffany, Hyoyeon, Yuri, Sooyoung, Yoona, Seohyun.

added configuration for :
- pixel size
- dots instead of blocks

Version 1.0

data.description:
Big pixel time with animated  time transition.

Version (1.4)

Configurable:
- US Date Format (MM.DD)
- 12H Time Format 
- Weekday Strings
- Show Date in Pixel Field on Shake
  - Time Date is shown
- Animation on shake (on/off)
- Dots instead of Blocks
- Pixel Size
- Bluetooth disc. vibrate
- Animation Time

Also new:
Reshow current configuration in Config Screen.

Next Version will feature:
- Hourly Vibration
- Show Battery on Shake


Feature Requests and Bug Reports are highly welcome ! 
Even if i don't reply, please be sure i read them. :)

Please give a heart if you like this watchface :)

**
Attention iOS/Apple User:  The Description you read here is always for the latest Version out. Unfourtunatly Apple wants to prove the Javascript in all Pebble Apps. Till Apple does this you will only see the latest approved Version. There is nothing i can do about that.
**

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed Error with configuration Screen not showing
